content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-027-09-A
|Item_parent=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Item_parent_short=Prevention of foetal risks: infection, drugs, toxic substances, irradiation
|Rank=A
|Title=Knowing the definition of maternal-fetal measles
|Description=None
|Rubric=Definition
|Contributors=Alexandre Vivanti, Philippe Deruelle
|Order=9}}
The risk of transmission is possible at the end of pregnancy and may result in neonatal congenital measles, but this is exceptional (given vaccination coverage).

question.title: What is the risk of transmission of maternal-fetal measles during pregnancy?

option_a.title: The risk of transmission is possible at the end of pregnancy.

option_b.title: Maternal-fetal measles is a rare condition.

option_c.title: The risk of transmission is extremely low.

option_d.title: Maternal-fetal measles is a common condition.

correct_option.title: The risk of transmission is possible at the end of pregnancy.
correct_option.description: This consists only a letter of the correct option
